summary: Email correspondence between law enforcement officials discussing draft search warrant affidavit to expand search of Jeffrey Epstein's electronic devices. The email includes coordination between NYPD/FBI task force members and Assistant U.S. Attorney regarding affidavit preparation and questions about evidence.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The search warrant affidavit seeks authorization to expand the scope of searching his electronic devices.

persons.name: Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned in question about whether photos of her were found on discs seized from Epstein's NY residence.

persons.name: Judge Gorenstein
persons.context: The target judge for submitting the search warrant affidavit for authorization.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Author of the email coordinating the search warrant affidavit preparation and seeking input from task force members.

persons.name: Detective NYPD / FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force Officer
persons.context: Recipient of the email who made edits to the search warrant affidavit draft, including correcting technical details about hard drives.

connections.description: Maxwell is mentioned in connection with evidence seized from Epstein's NY residence, suggesting investigative interest in their relationship.

connections.person2: Detective NYPD / FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force Officer
connections.description: Working together on preparing search warrant affidavit for Epstein's devices, with email coordination and edits.
Prosecutor planning to submit search warrant affidavit to judge for authorization.

events.title: Search warrant affidavit preparation
events.description: Law enforcement officials coordinate preparation of search warrant affidavit to expand search of Jeffrey Epstein's electronic devices.
personsInvolved: Detective NYPD / FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force Officer

events.title: Planned swearing of search warrant
events.description: Planned date for swearing out the search warrant affidavit following submission to Judge Gorenstein.

locations: St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Law enforcement was preparing a search warrant affidavit in June 2020 to expand the search of Jeffrey Epstein's electronic devices.
The affidavit draft included questions about whether photos of Maxwell were found on discs seized from Epstein's New York residence.
Technical corrections were made to the affidavit regarding Seagate hard drives (correcting '100 hard drives' to 'Seagate path 100 hard drive').
The search warrant was planned to be submitted to Judge Gorenstein for authorization.
The email shows ongoing investigation into Epstein's devices even after his death in 2019.
